caseinfo.name: case name one
caseinfo.description: maps to the first two phases of the clinical reasoning cycle

children.name: Context
context: has found it increasingly difficult to manage at home on her own
especially with the steep steps to her front door and a large garden to maintain
found the increasing volume of traffic intimidating and quit driving
was assessed by an Aged Care Assessment Team (ACAT) and moved into Sunnybanks, a lowcare residential   aged-care facility
Her son is her only family, and he lives on the other side of the city. He and his wife, take her out to lunch every other Sunday
when moved to Sunnybanks, Dr ABC, her general practitioner (GP), conducted a comprehensive medical assessment
was assessed as competent to administer her own medicines

caseinfo.name: Triggers
triggers: A few weeks ago, Mrs Annon was admitted to hospital after experiencing dizziness and fainting. She was diagnosed with atrial fibrillation and while in hospital, she started taking atenolol 50 mg daily and warfarin 3 mg daily
was discharged from hospital and returned to Sunnybanks. Her international normalised ratio (INR) on discharge was 2.5
Last Sunday, when Mrs Annon�s son collected her, he mentioned to one of the Sunnybanks� nurses that he thought his mother was becoming more forgetful
